page.title: 14WOODLANDS MILL
page.content: {Woodlands Mill}is situated on the edge of the Pennines, Barrow Lane, Steeton.Built in 1750 beside a stream a dam powered a water wheel.The mill spun wool into worsted yarn for men's suits. The worsted industry thrived along the Pennines because of fast flowing water for the waterwheels.The water was soft & cleaned grease from raw wool. In 1940 the Fletcher family bought the mill changing from waterwheel to electric power.A fire in 1975 destroyed a warehouse & catwalk. Today Woodlands Mill has 100 workers, 53 shuttle looms & 20 Rapier looms .It is now owned by Courtaulds & weaves furniture & dress fabric,curtains & brocade.2%_3% of their yarn is imported & 5% exported to the Far East, Australia & New Zealand.
